page.title: 17TOURISM - Accommodation
page.content: 1 {Red Lion }- village inn serving food, 4 letting bedrooms, 3 doubles, 1 single. Average season March-October, caters for about 50 people,B&B Evening meal. Most people use the inn as base for walking, visiting places of local interest eg Bowes Museum. Some people return each year, mainly from the south of England and use the inn as a break during the journey to Scotland. 2 {Fox & Hounds}- village inn serving food. Also holiday cottage which is let during the season March-October. Average season some 80 people use this cottage. Mostly from the south of England as a base for visiting such places as Hadrian's Wall, High Force, Lake District, Northumbrian Coast, N Yorkshire Moors. These people are often on a first visit to the 'North' and find the area most impressive.
